description: Re-rated top 50 models with signal-informed External Context (EC) scores. Previous EC was computed algorithmically with defaults. This version uses real v3-5 force signals across F1-F6 to assess 5 EC sub-dimensions: supply_chain_dependency, regulatory_contagion, competitive_import, leading_indicator_transfer, resource_talent_flow.

methodology.ec_definition: How much does international context materially change viability vs US-only assessment?

sub_dimensions.supply_chain_dependency: Does the model depend on supply chains with geopolitical exposure? Higher score = LESS dependency (more resilient).
sub_dimensions.regulatory_contagion: Does the model benefit from or face risk from cross-border regulatory dynamics (EU AI Act, CMMC, export controls)? Higher = more benefit.
sub_dimensions.competitive_import: Does international competition (DeepSeek, China AI ecosystem, P-028 bifurcation) threaten or benefit the model? Higher = more international competitive moat.
sub_dimensions.leading_indicator_transfer: Can international signals (Japan demographics, EU regulation, China automation) provide advance intelligence for this model? Higher = more signal transfer.
sub_dimensions.resource_talent_flow: Does the model benefit from or suffer from international talent/resource flows (H-1B changes, critical minerals, Gulf AI pivot)? Higher = more benefit.

key_findings: Defense models were overrated on EC — already had high scores (9.5-10.0) that are validated by real signals, but some maxed-out scores lacked nuance (supply chain dependency for defense hardware is real).

EU AI Act enforcement (Aug 2026) is the single strongest EC factor — models with EU regulatory exposure see large EC upward revisions. V3-GEO-004 (EU AI Act CaaS) was UNDERRATED at EC 6.0 — raised to 8.0.

P-028 (US-China AI Bifurcation) now VERY STRONG — DeepSeek V4 imminent with coding superiority claims, 89% China AI market share. Models with purely US focus that compete against open-source Chinese alternatives face competitive import pressure.
H-1B overhaul ($100K fee) creates new resource_talent_flow dimension for US tech/AI models — talent supply constraint that increases demand for AI augmentation but restricts talent availability.
Gulf AI pivot ($130B+ committed) validates models with Middle East export potential.
Critical minerals weaponization (China export controls on rare earths + lithium) directly impacts physical product models (manufacturing, energy, medical devices).
Financial services cascade models have strong EC due to international regulatory precedent (EU AI Act creating compliance playbook that transfers to US).

models.name: AI Governance and Compliance Operating System
models.reasoning: EU AI Act high-risk obligations effective Aug 2, 2026 with EUR 35M/7% penalties DIRECTLY validates this model. 1,208 US state AI bills (145 enacted) create multi-jurisdictional complexity. AI governance market growing 37% CAGR ($309M to $4.8B). The insurance-governance loop (18% purchasing model-failure insurance) creates self-reinforcing demand. EC was already high but understated regulatory_contagion: EU AI Act is the strongest EC driver in the entire engine.

models.name: Autonomous Drone Swarm Command Platform
models.reasoning: EC of 10.0 was maximum. Signal-informed review reveals supply_chain_dependency is NOT perfect: critical minerals (China controls 70% of 19/20 strategic minerals), copper deficit ($11K/tonne), and semiconductor export controls create real supply chain risk for drone hardware. CMMC 2.0 enforcement and $9.4B unmanned aerial budget validate the rest. Slight downgrade from 10.0 to 9.5 for supply chain realism.

models.name: Cybersecurity AI for Defense Networks
models.reasoning: Software-based defense model with minimal supply chain dependency. DeepSeek V4 coding superiority claims make Chinese AI a direct cybersecurity threat — increasing demand for defensive AI. NATO 3.5% GDP target and European defense spending +83% create export market. $66B DoD IT budget pivoting to AI. CMMC 2.0 creating mandatory cybersecurity requirements for 220K+ DIB companies. EC upgrade justified by strengthened international demand signals.

models.name: Defense AI/ML Intelligence Fusion Platform
models.reasoning: Maven program confirmed 100% machine-generated intelligence by mid-2026. $13.4B dedicated AI/autonomy budget validates structural spending. ITAR/CMMC create strong regulatory moat. European defense AI market projected $5-10B+ by 2030 creates export opportunity. EC appropriately rated at 9.5 — supply chain dependency slightly reduces from perfect score due to cloud infrastructure needs in classified environments.

models.name: Micro-Firm AI Operating System
models.reasoning: Primarily US-domestic model with limited international context. Open-source AI (DeepSeek V3.2 at $0.028/M tokens) makes input costs near-zero globally — beneficial. EU AI Act does not directly impact US micro-firms. H-1B overhaul reduces available tech talent, increasing demand for AI-augmented micro-firms (positive). India's skills gap (95% engineers unfit for software) limits competitive import from India GCC model. No change warranted.

models.name: Healthcare AI Multi-State Compliance Platform
models.reasoning: Strong EC but slight downgrade: EU AI Act healthcare provisions create regulatory playbook that transfers to US (positive), but the 34-point healthcare trust gap is a GLOBAL phenomenon, not uniquely advantageous for US-based platforms. 1,250+ FDA AI device approvals (transparency score 3.3/17) means compliance demand is real but the international transfer is less direct than initially assessed. Leading_indicator_transfer remains 10 because EU regulation leads US by 18-24 months.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize CNC Shop (Single Site)
models.reasoning: Significant EC upgrade based on: (1) CHIPS Act production phase creates downstream demand for CNC/precision manufacturing, (2) 81% plan reshoring but only 2% completed — reshoring REQUIRES domestic manufacturing capacity expansion, (3) Japan leading indicator: cobot SME adoption doubled 27%->50%, confirming manufacturing AI pathway, (4) Defense $13.4B AI/autonomy budget requires domestic manufacturing base, (5) CMMC 2.0 creates defense manufacturing moat. Supply chain dependency downgraded slightly: critical minerals and copper constraints affect manufacturing inputs.

models.name: AI Financial Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)
models.reasoning: Financial services cascade model validated by v3-5 signals: 98% of financial institutions using AI, $930B CRE maturity wall creating data demand, EU PSD2/MiFID precedent transfers to US compliance needs. FinTech investment $116B (+21% YoY) confirms capital flow. P-028 bifurcation less relevant here (financial data is jurisdiction-specific). Upgrade reflects strengthened regulatory_contagion and leading_indicator_transfer.

models.name: Full-Service AI Wholesale Brokerage
models.reasoning: Wholesale distribution has moderate international exposure. Supply chain dependency is real (45-55% of inputs in many wholesale categories are imported). US-China tariff framework (145% potential reduction to 10-20%) directly affects wholesale economics. Mexico nearshoring (labor 20-30% below China) creates new sourcing opportunities. H-1B changes reduce tech talent availability but wholesale is less tech-intensive. Upgrade reflects tariff/trade signals from F3 that materially affect viability.

models.name: Defense Predictive Maintenance AI
models.reasoning: Army PANDA predictive maintenance program validated. $13.4B defense AI budget includes $150M for legacy system replacement. But supply chain consideration: IoT sensors and edge computing hardware for maintenance systems have some dependency on semiconductor supply (CHIPS Act helps but not resolved). Critical minerals in sensor components. Slight downgrade from 9.5 to 9.0 for supply chain realism.

models.name: Defense Logistics AI Optimizer
models.reasoning: Defense logistics AI market $2.73B (2026) to $5.3B (2030) validates demand. But EC of 10.0 was inflated: defense logistics ITSELF depends on international supply chains that are under stress (critical minerals, copper deficit, China export controls). The model optimizes logistics that face supply chain disruptions — it benefits from complexity but also inherits the dependency. CMMC/ITAR regulatory moat remains maximum. NATO expansion creates export market.

models.name: Satellite/Space ISR AI Analytics
models.reasoning: Space ISR has significant supply chain dependency: satellite components rely on semiconductor supply chains (ITAR-controlled but still dependent on TSMC/foundry access), rare earth magnets for sensors, and specialized materials. CHIPS Act Arizona fabs help but space-grade electronics remain supply-constrained. The intelligence fusion capability is software-dominant (higher EC) but the satellite hardware layer is supply-exposed. European space defense spending rising. Downgrade from 10.0 to 9.0.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Specialty Food Producer
models.reasoning: Food production has direct supply chain dependency on agricultural inputs, some internationally sourced. Tariff uncertainty (145% -> 10-20% potential reduction) affects imported ingredients. But Silver Tsunami (+35% SBA acquisition loans) strongly validates acquire-and-modernize thesis. Japan/China demographics creating labor shortage patterns that transfer as leading indicators for US automation needs in food production. Slight downgrade for supply chain reality.

models.name: Multi-Shop CNC/Metal Fab Rollup Platform
models.reasoning: Same rationale as C7-AM-MFG-01 amplified by rollup scale: CHIPS Act downstream demand, reshoring intent (81% plan/2% completed gap = demand for domestic manufacturing capacity), CMMC 2.0 creating defense manufacturing moat (220K+ DIB companies must certify, 15-20% expected to exit — survivors gain share). Japan cobot adoption doubling as leading indicator. Metal prices (copper $11K+/tonne) are a supply chain risk for raw materials. Net upgrade.

models.name: Insurance AI Compliance + Bias Auditing Platform
models.reasoning: Insurance AI compliance is software-only with minimal supply chain dependency. EU AI Act explicitly covers AI in insurance decision-making — regulatory contagion is maximum. 90% of insurers evaluating GenAI creates immediate compliance demand. State AI legislation explosion (1,208 bills) adds domestic regulatory complexity. Insurance-governance loop (18% buying model-failure insurance) validates. Small downgrade from 10.0 because competitive_import is strong (Solvency II framework in EU creates separate compliance infrastructure that doesn't directly transfer).

models.name: Full-Service Prior Auth + Denial Management for Independent Practices
models.reasoning: US healthcare system is uniquely complex — prior auth/denial management has LIMITED international transfer. EU and other healthcare systems have fundamentally different payment structures. This is a US-domestic regulatory arbitrage play. Nursing shortage (9.6% vacancy, 500K+ shortfall by 2030) validates the staff augmentation angle. H-1B overhaul reduces available physician talent, increasing demand for AI-augmented practice operations. Slight downgrade for limited cross-border relevance.

models.name: Corporate AI Reskilling-as-a-Service
models.reasoning: Reskilling demand is GLOBAL: every advanced economy faces AI displacement. EU AI Act mandates workforce impact assessments. India's skills gap (95% engineers unfit for software, 80% unskilled workforce) creates massive export opportunity for reskilling platforms. H-1B overhaul creates domestic reskilling imperative as foreign talent access restricts. Germany 628K unfilled positions. Corporate training market $353B growing to $740B. Upgrade for strengthened international demand signals and India export opportunity.

models.name: EU AI Act Compliance-as-a-Service
models.reasoning: LARGEST EC UPGRADE. Previous EC of 6.0 was a serious error — this model's ENTIRE thesis is international regulatory context. EU AI Act high-risk obligations effective Aug 2, 2026 with EUR 35M/7% penalties. Digital Omnibus may postpone to Dec 2027 but uncertainty INCREASES compliance consulting demand. 30+ founders signed open letter against the Act but NO major AI companies have left EU. This is the most time-urgent EC-driven opportunity in the engine. Resource_talent_flow is weak (need EU-based regulatory expertise, which is scarce).

models.name: Defense Supply Chain Reshoring Enabler
models.reasoning: Directly validated by F3 signals: 81% plan reshoring, 2% completed — the gap IS the opportunity. CHIPS Act entering production phase (TSMC ahead of schedule, Samsung Taylor with Tesla/Alphabet contracts). China semiconductor equipment self-sufficiency 13.6%->35% means window for US advantage is SHRINKING. CMMC 2.0 + ITAR requirements for domestic sourcing create regulatory demand. Critical minerals weaponization by China makes defense supply chain diversification urgent. Significant upgrade.

models.name: Full-Service AI Finance Function for SMBs
models.reasoning: US-domestic SMB finance function has limited international context. US tax code, GAAP, and regulatory environment are US-specific. Open-source AI cost reduction benefits the model (lower delivery costs) but this is F1, not EC. CPA pipeline collapse (-32%, 20-year low at 55,152 degrees) is a US-specific demographic signal. No meaningful change from international context.

models.name: Full-Service AI Medical Equipment Distribution
models.reasoning: Medical equipment distribution has significant international supply chain exposure (China-manufactured components, critical minerals in devices). But F3 signals reveal: 1,250+ FDA AI device approvals creating regulatory demand for AI-enabled distribution, EU MDR (Medical Device Regulation) creating compliance requirements that transfer to US, and Gulf AI pivot ($23B Humain deals) creating healthcare export demand. Nursing shortage (9.6% vacancy) drives need for more efficient supply to understaffed facilities. Upgrade for regulatory_contagion and leading_indicator_transfer from EU/Gulf.

models.name: Full-Service AI Landscaping Operations
models.reasoning: Purely domestic service business with minimal international context. H-1B overharound affects some landscaping labor supply (H-2B visa for seasonal workers is adjacent issue). No significant regulatory contagion or competitive import. Japan robotics as leading indicator for outdoor automation is the only meaningful international signal. Marginal downgrade.

models.name: AI Operations Platform for Building Equipment Contractors
models.reasoning: Building trades have moderate supply chain exposure (HVAC equipment, copper for electrical, imported fixtures). Manufacturing labor shortage (415K unfilled, 20.6% plants below capacity) is a US phenomenon with international supply chain implications. Data center cooling demand (75.8 GW projected 2026, water conflicts) creates specific HVAC/cooling opportunity but this is primarily domestic. No change.

models.name: Critical Minerals AI Supply Chain Platform
models.reasoning: F6 signals DIRECTLY validate: China controls refining of 19/20 strategic minerals (avg 70%), imposed export controls on rare earths (Apr 2025) AND lithium battery chain (Oct 2025). Western alternatives 5-10 years from scale. EU 60 Strategic Projects. Copper above $11K/tonne (+30% in 2 years). This model sits at the EXACT intersection of the most acute EC signal in the engine. Supply_chain_dependency score of 10 reflects that the model's VALUE comes from the dependency (it helps manage it). Upgrade.

models.name: European Defense-Tech AI Platform (AI Act Compliant)
models.reasoning: STRONG UPGRADE. European defense spending record $693B+ (+83% from 2020). European defense startups raised $8.7B in 2025 (record). Germany EUR 95B defense (+16% YoY), projecting EUR 162B by 2029. NATO 5% GDP target by 2035. EU AI Act creates COMPLIANCE MOAT — AI-Act-compliant defense platforms gain market access that non-compliant US competitors cannot achieve. European Defense Fund >EUR 1B earmarked for AI. This model's EC was underrated at 8.5 given the massive European defense surge confirmed by v3-5 signals.

models.name: AI Operations for Elder Care/Disability Services
models.reasoning: Upgrade driven by F2 demographics: Japan is the LEADING INDICATOR for elder care — sub-700K annualized births, robot density 419/10K, elder care robotics most advanced globally. Japan-tested solutions directly transferable to US as worker-to-senior ratio falls from 4:1 to 2.9:1. HHA shortage ~446K at $16.82/hr (barely above fast food). China birth collapse (17%) means China elder care market will exceed Japan's within 10 years. International leading indicator transfer is the key EC upgrade.

models.name: Dual-Use Autonomous Vehicle Platform (Defense + Commercial)
models.reasoning: SIGNIFICANT DOWNGRADE. EC of 10.0 was significantly inflated for a physical product platform. Autonomous vehicles have HEAVY supply chain dependency: semiconductors (CHIPS Act helps but not fully resolved), LiDAR/sensor components (rare earth magnets), batteries (China controls lithium-ion supply chain, export controls imposed Oct 2025), copper ($11K/tonne for electrical systems). The dual-use thesis is strong (defense $13.4B + commercial AV market) but the physical supply chain reality reduces EC. ITAR creates regulatory moat for defense side.

models.name: Cross-Border AI Regulatory Arbitrage Platform
models.reasoning: Model's ENTIRE thesis is cross-border regulatory context. EU AI Act + 1,208 US state bills + China AI governance + UK post-Brexit framework create maximum regulatory complexity. The regulatory divergence between jurisdictions is INCREASING (EU AI Act high-risk Aug 2026, Trump preemption EO vs 280 state lawmakers resisting, India separate AI governance). This is a structural growth vector for regulatory arbitrage. Current EC of 9.5 is appropriate.

models.name: AI-Native Accounting Practice Platform
models.reasoning: CPA pipeline collapse is US-specific (55,152 degrees, 20-year low) but UK Big Four graduate listings -44% YoY provides international leading indicator. KPMG UK audit cuts signal global industry direction. Open-source AI (DeepSeek at $0.028/M tokens) reduces input costs. Limited regulatory contagion since accounting standards (GAAP vs IFRS) diverge. Small upgrade for leading indicator transfer from UK accounting profession trends.

models.name: Grid Interconnection Consulting and Expediting Platform
models.reasoning: US grid interconnection is a domestic regulatory process (FERC, PJM, ISO-specific). International context is limited. However: data center demand is global (75.8 GW US, total 448 TWh global), creating international precedent for queue management. FERC Order 2023 + DOE April 2026 deadline for large-load acceleration are US-specific. Slight upgrade for global data center demand driving domestic queue urgency. Gulf AI pivot (1.9 GW Saudi data center capacity) indirectly validates DC-related infrastructure models.

models.name: AI Adaptive Tutoring Engine (K-12)
models.reasoning: K-12 tutoring is heavily influenced by domestic psychology: 55% of Americans uncomfortable with AI in education (highest friction sector, gap of 5). EU AI Act classifies education as HIGH-RISK AI, creating compliance burden NOT opportunity for US K-12 platforms. DeepSeek V3.2 provides competitive alternative at 87% lower cost. India's skills gap creates potential export market but K-12 tutoring is culture-specific. Slight downgrade for EU regulatory headwind and domestic psychology constraints limiting international scale.

models.name: AI-Native HVAC/Cooling Equipment for Data Centers
models.reasoning: F6 signals DIRECTLY validate: 160+ data centers in water-scarce areas, Phoenix 177M gal/day for ~60 centers, regulators mandating dry/hybrid cooling. Global demand: 75.8 GW (2026) to 134.4 GW (2030). Gulf AI pivot (1.9 GW Saudi, 1 GW UAE) creates massive international demand for cooling solutions in hot climates. Supply chain dependency is moderate (copper, refrigerants, specialized components). Current EC of 8.5 is accurately calibrated.

models.name: AI Safety Audit and Red Team Service
models.reasoning: EU AI Act requires conformity assessment for high-risk AI systems, directly creating demand for safety auditing. US state legislation (1,208 bills, 145 enacted) creates domestic regulatory demand. AI governance market $309M to $4.8B (37% CAGR). Insurance carriers linking premiums to governance certification creates market pull. DeepSeek V4 coding superiority claims increase red-teaming demand. Upgrade for regulatory_contagion from EU AI Act mandate.

models.name: AI Environmental Consulting/Compliance
models.reasoning: Environmental compliance has strong international regulatory dimensions: EU CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive), data center water conflicts (160+ in scarce areas), critical minerals environmental review for new mining projects. FERC grid interconnection reform + DOE April 2026 deadline create environmental review demand. Copper mining environmental constraints in Chile/Peru affect supply chain. Small upgrade for EU environmental regulation transfer.

models.name: AI Workforce Orchestration Platform
models.reasoning: Workforce orchestration benefits from H-1B overhaul ($100K fee) which restricts foreign talent access and increases demand for AI workforce augmentation. EU labor crisis (Germany 628K vacancies, Italy 500K import plan) validates the need globally. Gartner 40% enterprise AI agent embed by end-2026 directly drives demand. Staffing industry collapse (RHI -53%) creates market vacuum. Upgrade for international workforce shortage validation.

models.name: AI Chemical Distribution with Safety Intelligence
models.reasoning: Chemical distribution has significant supply chain exposure: critical minerals weaponization by China affects chemical feedstocks, tariff uncertainty (145%->10-20%) impacts imported chemicals. EU REACH regulation creates compliance demand that transfers to US chemical safety requirements. Environmental compliance for chemical distribution is tightening globally. Small upgrade for regulatory_contagion from EU chemical safety precedent.

models.name: AI-Native Pharmaceutical Distribution Intelligence
models.reasoning: Pharmaceutical distribution has high supply chain dependency: 80%+ of API (active pharmaceutical ingredients) sourced from India/China. China rare earth/mineral export controls could affect pharmaceutical manufacturing inputs. EU pharmaceutical regulation creates compliance playbook. FDA AI device approvals (1,250+) create adjacent regulatory demand. India pharmaceutical export dependency creates P-028 bifurcation exposure. Small upgrade for supply chain awareness and regulatory transfer.

models.name: Physical-Digital Convergence Consulting
models.reasoning: Physical-digital convergence (cobot adoption, AI manufacturing, digital twin) has strong international leading indicators: Japan cobot SME adoption doubled 27%->50%, China robot density surpassed Germany/Japan at 470/10K, Figure AI $39B humanoid production. Consulting opportunity validated by manufacturing AI readiness gap (98% exploring, 21% ready = 77-point gap). CHIPS Act physical production validates convergence thesis. Small upgrade for international leading indicator transfer.

models.name: AI-Native Medical Device Contract Manufacturer
models.reasoning: Medical device manufacturing has SIGNIFICANT supply chain dependency that was underweighted at EC 9.0: critical minerals in sensors and electronics, semiconductor components, specialized plastics and metals with some China-sourced inputs. China export controls on rare earths directly affect medical device components. FDA AI device approvals (1,250+ cumulative) validate AI integration demand. EU MDR creates parallel compliance requirements. Supply chain dependency downgrade from 9.0 to 8.0.

models.name: Deepfake Detection and Digital Identity Shield
models.reasoning: DeepSeek V4 with coding superiority + open-source model proliferation INCREASES deepfake creation capability globally. P-028 bifurcation means Chinese open-source models are widely available for malicious content generation. EU AI Act explicitly addresses synthetic media and deepfakes. Human premium crystallizing (50% ad premiums for human-verified content, Veriff building blockchain stamps for Meta/Google). Biometric verification demand is global. Upgrade for P-028-driven threat expansion and EU regulatory pull.

models.name: AI-Enhanced Independent Pharmacy Operations
models.reasoning: Independent pharmacy is US-domestic with moderate supply chain dependency (pharmaceutical APIs 80%+ from India/China). China lithium-ion battery supply chain export controls are tangential but critical minerals controls could affect drug precursor supply. US pharmacy regulation is domestic. UK/EU pharmacy models provide limited leading indicator transfer. Marginal downgrade for supply chain awareness.

models.name: Acquire PE-Distressed Accounting Practice
models.reasoning: PE distress acquisition benefits from F4 capital signals: $1.5-1.8T CRE+PE debt maturity wall, PE-backed companies = 70% of large bankruptcies. UK Big Four graduate listings -44% is leading indicator for US accounting profession direction. Open-source AI cost decline makes acquired practice operations cheaper. But accounting regulation is US-specific (GAAP, state CPA licensure). Small upgrade for leading indicator transfer from UK and PE distress signals.

models.name: Insurance Claims Intelligence Platform
models.reasoning: Insurance claims processing is global but regulatory frameworks differ significantly by jurisdiction. EU AI Act covers insurance AI decision-making. 90% of insurers evaluating GenAI, 55% implemented in core functions. FS cascade confirms claims as 'first autopilot domain.' But competitive_import is moderate — incumbent insurers (Allianz, AXA, Zurich) are building internal capabilities. Slight downgrade for competitive import reality.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Independent Auto Repair Shop
models.reasoning: Auto repair is purely domestic service. Supply chain dependency exists for parts (OEM and aftermarket parts increasingly sourced globally). Tariff uncertainty affects parts pricing. But the core acquisition-and-modernize thesis relies on Silver Tsunami (+35% SBA acquisition loans) and domestic AI integration, neither of which has significant international context. No change.

models.name: Full-Service AI Property Management
models.reasoning: Property management is US-domestic with limited international context. CRE signals (20% office vacancy, $930B maturing 2026) are US-specific and already captured in other axes. Building materials have supply chain dependency. Adaptive reuse ordinances (LA, NYC) create management demand for converted properties. Marginal upgrade for CRE cascade-driven demand.

models.name: Multi-Facility Specialty Food Production Platform
models.reasoning: Multi-facility food production has significant supply chain dependency: agricultural inputs, food safety imports, specialty ingredients. Tariff uncertainty (145%->10-20%) affects ingredient costs. EU food safety regulation creates compliance playbook. But the primary value driver is domestic (Silver Tsunami acquisition + AI operations), limiting international context benefit. Slight downgrade for supply chain dependency reality.

models.name: Nursing Facility Operations Platform
models.reasoning: Japan is the LEADING INDICATOR for nursing facility automation — 419/10K robot density, sub-700K births, elder care robotics most advanced. China demographic collapse (7.9M births, -17%) means China elder care demand will exceed Japan within a decade. These international signals validate the urgency. But US nursing regulation is domestic (CMS, state licensing). Medical equipment supply chain has some international dependency. Slight downgrade for overweight on regulatory_contagion in domestic-regulated sector.

models.name: AI-Augmented Professional Micro-Firm Operating System
models.reasoning: Professional micro-firms are US-domestic with limited international context. Open-source AI (87% cost advantage) benefits cost structure. H-1B overhaul ($100K fee) reduces available professional talent, increasing demand for AI-augmented micro-firms. EU AI Act professional services provisions provide minor leading indicator. Very small upgrade for H-1B-driven demand increase.

models.name: Teacher Augmentation Platform (Admin + Lesson Prep)
models.reasoning: Teacher shortage is global (EU, Japan facing similar pipeline issues) providing leading indicator validation. 83% of K-12 teachers already using generative AI, 60% daily. But US education system is domestically regulated (state boards, local school districts). EU AI Act classifies education as high-risk — creates compliance burden for any platform with EU ambitions. Teacher augmentation tools face 55% public discomfort (highest fear friction gap = 5). No change warranted — international context is moderate.

models.name: Clinical Denial Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)
models.reasoning: Clinical denial management is uniquely US (prior authorization is primarily a US healthcare system phenomenon). EU single-payer systems have different claim structures. International context is limited to AI technology inputs (commoditizing) and EU medical device AI regulation as weak leading indicator. No change warranted.

biggest_gainers.name: EU AI Act Compliance-as-a-Service
biggest_gainers.reason: Previous EC of 6.0 was a scoring error for a model whose ENTIRE thesis is EU regulatory context. Aug 2026 deadline with EUR 35M penalties makes this the most time-urgent EC opportunity.

biggest_gainers.reason: International robotics signals (Japan cobot doubling, China surpassing Germany/Japan in robot density) validate convergence consulting demand.

biggest_gainers.reason: European defense spending record $693B+ (+83%). EU AI Act compliance creates market access moat for compliant defense platforms.

biggest_gainers.reason: 81% plan reshoring but 2% completed — the gap IS the opportunity. CHIPS Act production phase + China equipment self-sufficiency 35% means shrinking window.

biggest_gainers.reason: EU AI Act requires conformity assessment. Insurance-governance loop validates. DeepSeek V4 increases red-teaming demand.

biggest_losers.name: Dual-Use Autonomous Vehicle Platform
biggest_losers.reason: Physical supply chain dependency (semiconductors, batteries, rare earths, copper) was ignored at EC 10.0. China lithium-ion export controls directly threaten battery supply. Largest correction in the rerate.

biggest_losers.name: Full-Service AI Landscaping Operations
biggest_losers.reason: Purely domestic service with minimal EC relevance. Small EC downgrade compounds with other models moving up.

biggest_losers.name: AI-Native Medical Device Contract Manufacturer
biggest_losers.reason: Manufacturing supply chain dependency (critical minerals in sensors, semiconductor components) was underweighted at EC 9.0.

biggest_losers.reason: Space-grade electronics supply chain dependency (ITAR-controlled but foundry-dependent). Rare earth magnets for sensors.

biggest_losers.reason: EU AI Act classifies education as high-risk. 55% public discomfort limits international scaling. DeepSeek competitive threat at 87% lower cost.

pattern_effects.P-028_bifurcation: VERY STRONG per v3-5 signals. DeepSeek V4 imminent with coding superiority. 89% China AI market share. Any model competing in commodity AI faces pressure. Models with regulatory moats (defense, healthcare, insurance compliance) are INSULATED from bifurcation. Models without regulatory protection face competitive import risk.
pattern_effects.P-029_reshoring_gap: 81% plan, 2% completed. Semiconductors closing gap (TSMC ahead of schedule). General manufacturing still wide. Manufacturing models benefit; service models neutral.
pattern_effects.P-030_defense_supercycle: VERY STRONG. $13.4B dedicated AI line. $1.01T total defense. NATO 3.5% GDP target. European record spending. Software defense models validated; hardware defense models need supply chain realism.
pattern_effects.P-031_gulf_conversion: $130B+ committed. US approved advanced Nvidia exports to Gulf. Creates export market for infrastructure, cooling, middleware, and AI services models.

systematic_biases_corrected: DEFENSE HARDWARE EC INFLATION: Defense models with physical products (drones, vehicles, satellites) had EC scores of 10.0 that ignored supply chain dependencies. Supply chains for defense hardware depend on semiconductors, rare earths, copper, and batteries — all under geopolitical stress. Software-only defense models (cybersecurity, intelligence fusion) correctly maintain high EC.

EU AI ACT UNDERWEIGHTING: V3-GEO-004 had EC of 6.0 for a model whose entire thesis is EU regulatory context — a clear scoring error from algorithmic defaults. The Aug 2026 deadline makes this the most time-urgent EC opportunity. Similar underweighting affected V3-DEF-005 (European defense-tech).

DOMESTIC SERVICE OVERWEIGHT: Purely domestic service businesses (landscaping, auto repair, property management) had EC scores of 5.5-6.5 that were appropriate — confirmed by signal analysis. International context genuinely does not materially change viability for these models.

MANUFACTURING EC UNDERWEIGHT: CNC/metal fab models had EC of 6.5 that understated the reshoring demand signal (81% plan, 2% completed), CHIPS Act downstream demand, and CMMC defense manufacturing moat. Upgraded to 7.5.
